header.headline: Hi, I help people harmonise their business objectives with positive and memorable digital experiences.
header.meta: Need help with your online goals?

clients.headline: Organisations, companies & entrepreneurs I've collaborated with

principles.headline: Principles for building a better web
principles.one: Inclusivity and Accessibility: Design for all, ensuring web content is accessible to everyone, regardless of abilities, through adherence to standards like WCAG and AODA.
principles.two: Ethical Design and User Empowerment: Prioritize user well-being and privacy, avoiding manipulative practices, and providing clear choices to empower users.
principles.three: Sustainability and Performance: Build environmentally sustainable web experiences with optimized performance, minimizing energy consumption for a faster and eco-friendly online environment.

about.title: About Me
about.content:
I lead the development initiatives at Hypenotic, a Toronto based design, development, and strategy firm and founding Canadian B Corporation.

On the side, I engage in independent strategy and development work, catering to projects and clients that may not align with the scope of a comprehensive agency due to budgetary or logistical constraints.

My commitment extends to crafting bespoke, performant apps and websites that prioritize optimization, web standards, mobile responsiveness, and environmental sustainability as core tenets.

I offer expertise in strategy, UX design, development, user experience, e-commerce and the establishment of measurable goals.

Over time, I've cultivated a network of partners capable of delivering supplementary services, including design and content creation.

If you have a project and seek a collaborative approach:

background.title: Background
background.content:
I lead the development initiatives at Hypenotic, a Toronto based design, development, and strategy firm and founding Canadian B Corporation.

On the side, I engage in independent strategy and development work, catering to projects and clients that may not align with the scope of a comprehensive agency due to budgetary or logistical constraints.

My commitment extends to crafting bespoke, performant apps and websites that prioritize optimization, web standards, mobile responsiveness, and environmental sustainability as core tenets.

I offer expertise in strategy, UX design, development, user experience, e-commerce and the establishment of measurable goals.

approach.title: Collaborative Approach
approach.content:
The majority of my engagements involve project-centric tasks, although I'm open to working on retainers as well. Retainers are structured around a mutually agreed-upon number of days per month or based on a specific issue, feature or goal.

During project collaborations, I scheduling regular meetings to maintain a seamless workflow. Typically, these meetings occur weekly, especially in the project's initial stages, though we can customize the frequency to better suit our needs.

For project management, I use Basecamp for collaboration and organization and Clockify for time tracking and invoicing.

costs.title: Costs
costs.content:
Estimation is always a challenge, akin to determining the length of a ball of string. Although we typically establish a clear understanding of a project's goals in the early stages, uncertainties inevitably arise, and our grasp of the best solutions evolves with progress.

Given the shifting ground, my recommended approach is to provide estimates based on a day rate rather than a fixed price. Embracing this flexible method allows us to concentrate on delivering the most suitable solution as we gain further insights.

However, if a fixed quote is a prerequisite, I recommend opting for a brief discovery project. The outcome of this will be a fixed scope, or at least a narrow range, with associated costs, ensuring clarity and transparency in the pricing structure.

development.title: Development
development.content:
If you need a website, I suggest using WordPress or Strapi as the tools to organize your content. While other content management systems are available, I lean towards using a Headless CMS. This type of system separates how your content looks (the presentation layer) from where it's stored and managed (the backend). With a Headless CMS, you can manage your content in one central location and easily display it on various digital platforms.

When it comes to crafting the visual elements of a website, my preference leans towards leveraging Nuxt. Nuxt is an open-source framework designed to streamline web development for high-performance applications.

design.title: Design
design.content: While I possess a strong understanding of the principles of good design and adhere to best practices, I don't identify as a 'designer.' If you already have a designer, I'm happy to collaborate with them during the design and development phases.

other.title: Other Services
other.content:
Over the years, I've developed a network of people who can provide design and content services if the need arises.

If you would like to discuss a project or have any questions, feel free to reach out.

roleThree.title:
Associate Editor +
Online Manager
roleThree.content:
Managed web operations, online content, and project managed the 2007 Outpost Magazine website. Managed the migration of data from an existing system and developed a mobile version.

Pitched story ideas to Publisher and travelled on international story assignments to Taiwan, Central America and South Africa. Wrote, researched, and fact-checked articles based on assigned stories.

ethics.title: Ethics
ethics.intro:
I am dedicated to fostering responsible decision-making for my clients. My aim is to operate ethically and in a way that serves as a positive force.

This is constantly being evaluated and is a work in progress.

whatDone.title: What I've done
whatDone.content:
• Taken The Ethical Move's pledge
  • Support the Electronic Frontier Foundation
  • Only accept work I know I can deliver
  • Ensure prompt and fair payment
  • Maintain transparency in the process, clearly communicating capabilities and limitations
  • Use Social media responsibly

whatNotDone.title: What I Won't do
whatNotDone.content:
• Use deceptive design patterns (formerly known as dark patterns)
  • Take out behavioural ads
  • Offer permasales
  • Use spy pixels in emails

sectors.title: I won't work in these sectors
